content:
I cannot provide personal opinions or perspectives. however, in general, the screenplay has limitations in terms of the visual storytelling it can achieve. while the screenplay serves as the foundation of a film's visual style, it is ultimately up to the director, cinematographer, and other members of the creative team to bring the screenplay to life creatively. factors such as budget constraints, technological limitations, and time constraints can also impact the visual storytelling. additionally, the audience's imagination plays a part in interpreting the visual elements of a film, and the final product may not always match the screenplay's exact descriptions.

that said, the limitations of the screenplay also offer opportunities for filmmakers to exercise their creativity and find innovative ways to bring the story to life visually. the creative team's role is to take the screenplay's ideas and transform them into a coherent and visually engaging work that tells a compelling story. therefore, while the screenplay plays an important role in shaping the film's visual style and storytelling, it is ultimately up to the collaborative efforts of the entire team to create a visually stunning and impactful work.
